image.altText: Concept art showing interior of sports stadium with cricket match underway.

props.synopsis: Premier Jeremy Rockliff has spoken for the first time since a report by an independent economist found the Hobart stadium's construction timeline was unrealistic and costs "significantly understated".

title.children: AFL-imposed deadlines 'a challenge' for Hobart stadium

image.altText: boxes of prescription drug xanax

props.synopsis: The recreational use of Xanax, a pharmaceutical drug used to treat anxiety and sleep disorders, is increasing among young people. Experts warn a growing black-market and lack of education around the drug is putting lives at risk.

title.children: Recreational use of Xanax grows among young Australians

image.altText: Man with long grey hair in a pony tail and a red work shirt sits in outdoor area of his home with his hands in his lap

props.synopsis: The average out-of-pocket cost for a GP visit has risen by 4.1 per cent nationally over the past year, with patients in Tasmania, the ACT and NSW paying the most.

title.children: Tasmanians paying the highest out-of-pocket costs to visit a GP

image.altText: An image of a colourful reef with starfish and various deep sea creatures

props.synopsis: From red urchins to orange sea cucumbers, researchers monitoring the fastest-melting glacier in East Antarctica are surprised by new-found biodiversity under the ice at Bunger Hills.

title.children: Scientists discover 'thriving' marine life beneath Antarctic ice

image.altText: David Bowman

props.synopsis: The flammable Tasmanian blue gum has caused friction among Californians in the past for its role in wildfires. Scientists say the fire-loving tree is one factor in a complex story of climate change.

title.children: Scientists say fire-loving Tasmanian blue gums not to blame for LA fires

image.altText: A graphic showing a man's face in black and white against letters LGH.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police has determined there is insufficient evidence to proceed with criminal charges against the former boss of Tasmania's second largest public hospital over allegations of falsifying death certificates.

title.children: Police rule out investigating former hospital boss over falsified death certificates

image.altText: Coco Gauff, Frances Tiafoe, Harriet Dart composite

props.synopsis: Lucky losers Francesco Passaro and Harriet Dart enjoy their day out, while Frances Tiafoe just loses his lunch. Here's the five quick hits from the Australian Open, including who is playing on day three.

title.children: Five quick hits: Lucky losers winning and winners losing their lunch

image.altText: A graphic showing various internet imagery and Australia

props.synopsis: Labor is seeking to restore Kevin Rudd's original vision for the troubled NBN, but it has thorny issues to confront as internet customers look elsewhere.

title.children: Will Labor's NBN cash injection make your internet faster?

image.altText: A graphic showing a young boy looking up at an illustration of a brain

props.synopsis: England, the US and Canada are among the countries with national autism strategies — and now Australia has one too.

title.children: Here's what's in Australia's new national autism strategy

image.altText: Ukrainian soldiers standing next to a firing Howitzer artillery gun.

props.synopsis: Russian forces have been making steady territorial gains in Ukraine's east, amid reports of fatigue and strain among the ranks of Kyiv's military.

title.children: Russian forces threaten supply lines of stretched Ukrainian army

image.altText: A police van blocks entrance to a road.

props.synopsis: Four people are killed in a head-on crash involving a taxi and a station wagon, with police believing the driver who caused it intentionally drove on the wrong side of the road.

title.children: Driver made 'conscious' choice to drive wrong way down highway, killing four

image.altText: A side-by-side comparison of Los Angeles sites before and after wildfires hit

props.synopsis: Landmark buildings, homes, and shopping malls are among the structures destroyed in LA's affluent Pacific Palisades neighbourhood.

title.children: In pictures: Before and after LA's wildfires ripped through the Pacific Palisades

image.altText: A middle-aged white man and woman in orange shirts and black masks are walked by Indonesian police down a roadway.

props.synopsis: An Australian couple held in a Bali jail since October have had their detention "postponed" according to police, amid anger over a newspaper report claiming were released on bail.

title.children: Australian couple accused of running Bali brothel have detention postponed

image.altText: The gates of Perilya's south mine in Broken Hill open

props.synopsis: An underground fire at a Chinese-owned mine in Broken Hill re-ignites and spreads to multiple levels, as nearby residents are warned to stay inside for their safety.

title.children: Broken Hill mine fire re-ignites, locals warned of possible toxic smoke

image.altText: An image of a colourful reef with starfish and various deep sea creatures

props.synopsis: From red urchins to orange sea cucumbers, researchers monitoring the fastest-melting glacier in East Antarctica are surprised by new-found biodiversity under the ice at Bunger Hills.

title.children: Scientists discover 'thriving' marine life beneath Antarctic ice

image.altText: A man in grey hair and glasses stands in front of a podium

props.synopsis: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer hopes to use AI to boost efficiency in the public sector from education to detecting potholes.

title.children: UK PM lays out bid to become AI 'world leader', starting with civil servants

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Two people sit on graves. One has 1.5 in orange paint

props.synopsis: The protest was in reaction to recent news that global temperatures in 2024 had exceeded 1.5 Celsius above the pre-industrial era for the first time.

title.children: Climate activists paint on Charles Darwin's grave

image.altText: A white, three-storey stucco home stands among the rubble of neighbouring properties

props.synopsis: Standing out like a beacon on the Malibu coastline is this three-storey mansion. Here's why its owner believes it's still intact.

title.children: Why this Malibu house is still standing while the coastline is ash

image.altText: Sun setting over the Indian Ocean

props.synopsis: Temperatures in 2024 officially exceeded the Paris Agreement target. Does that mean the world has failed?

title.children: The world's breached 1.5 degrees. But wasn't that our climate target?

image.altText: Uralla Luscombe-Pedro

props.synopsis: WA officials have defended the state's prescribed burning strategy after an enormous tingle tree was destroyed in a recent fire.

title.children: Giant 400-year-old tingle tree accidentally destroyed by authorities

image.altText: Deng Atem rests his face on his hands with a sad expression.

props.synopsis: A father from Melbourne's south-west has issued a plea for justice after his 24-year-old son was killed on Friday night, two years after his other son was shot dead.

title.children: Melbourne father wants answers after two sons killed in separate attacks

image.altText: Floating the Australian dollar has benefited Australia during the GFC

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar is around its lowest level since 2020 against the US currency, continuing its move towards 61 US cents with a sharp fall over the weekend.

title.children: The steep descent of the Aussie dollar in a few short months

image.altText: Albanese smiles, standing the prime minister's courtyard.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese promises a $3 billion injection to "finish" the National Broadband Network and speed up internet services, as Labor and the Coalition swing into election campaign mode.

title.children: Labor to 'finish' NBN by upgrading FTN to fibre, PM says in election promise

image.altText: A race track damaged

props.synopsis: Police say they are keeping an open mind and it is too early to know if damage to a Gold Coast track ahead of Queensland's richest race day was deliberate.

title.children: Police identify poison used in Gold Coast Magic Millions track damage

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: SA Police have urged cyclists who use the bike path running alongside the Southern Expressway to be alert after separate crashes involving fence wire strung across the path.

title.children: Cyclists warned of wire strung across popular Adelaide bike path

image.altText: Exterior of Newcastle court.

props.synopsis: A man charged over anti-Semitic graffiti on the wall of a pharmacy in Newcastle remains in custody after refusing to answer a magistrate's question in court.

title.children: Man accused of painting Nazi symbol on wall refuses to speak in court

image.altText: Julian Leeser Liberal MP for Berowra stands outdoors and looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Julian Leeser has called for mandatory jail sentences for people convicted of vandalising synagogues following a string of incidents across Australia.

title.children: Federal MP calls for mandatory jail sentences for synagogue vandalism

image.altText: A tall waterspout emerging from water

props.synopsis: Residents in northern WA have been treated to heavy rainfall, a peculiar sunset and a waterspout over the ocean — and there may be more on the way.

title.children: Mother Nature puts on a show in the Pilbara with strange skies and a massive waterspout

image.altText: Arnold Frolows 2JJ T shirt

props.synopsis: One of the first people hired for the ABC's youth-focused radio station became one of Australian radio's most influential figures.

title.children: Arnold Frolows, who helped shape triple j's sound for decades, dies aged 74

image.altText: Police at Dreamworld

props.synopsis: A person has been taken into custody after an alleged assault near the entrance of Dreamworld on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Person in custody after alleged assault at Dreamworld

image.altText: A picture of a building sign

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment has burned through $107 million in the past three months alone, with analysts warning they would be "lucky" to make it to February "without a lifeline".

title.children: Star casinos likely to stay open if company enters administration, analysts say

image.altText: A man in his 60s smiling, selfie photo, sitting in an open air plane with a helmet on and dark sunglasses. Land below him.

props.synopsis: A 63-year-old man who died in an ultralight plane crash south-east of Darwin on Sunday has been identified.

title.children: Pilot killed in ultralight plane crash near Darwin identified

image.altText: Visitors alight from the ferry onto Rockingham's Penguin Island

props.synopsis: Conservationists are calling for Penguin Island to be closed to visitors to allow the dwindling little penguin population to recover — but the state government insists the decline is due to climate change, not tourism.

title.children: Calls for Penguin Island to shut amid wildlife loss
